main_definition: Editions refer to different versions or printings of a work, especially in publishing.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Different versions of a published book
meanings_and_examples.example: The 'Classic' edition of the novel features illustrations by famous artist John Doe.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Reprints or updates of existing works
meanings_and_examples.example: The scientific journal issued new editions every year to include recent research findings.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A particular number in a sequence, often used for reference
meanings_and_examples.example: In the series 'Planet Earth,' there are 10 editions covering different regions of our planet.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Different translations or versions of a text into other languages
meanings_and_examples.example: The play was translated into multiple editions in Spanish, French, and German to reach diverse audiences.
